snippet: The C.D.C. was supposed to be the federal agency that we could trust without fail.
abstract: Joe Nocera Op-Ed column holds that Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's handling of Ebola epidemic had tarnished reputation of agency once thought highly competent; contends CDC's approach to serious disease was too hubristic, and that such mistakes place agency among others that have earned public distrust.
lead_paragraph: The C.D.C. was supposed to be the federal agency that we could trust without fail.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
